description: The concentric layout positions nodes in concentric circles, based on a numeric value of some node property. Placing nodes with higher value in levels towards the center

animate.description: Whether to transition the node positions

animationDuration.description: Duration of animation in ms if enabled

animationEasing.description: Easing of animation if enabled. For possible values see `transition-timing-function` at [easing](http://js.cytoscape.org/#style/transition-animation)

avoidOverlap.description: Prevents node overlap, may overflow bounding-box and radius if not enough space

clockwise.description: Whether the layout should go clockwise (true) or counterclockwise/anticlockwise (false)

concentric.description: Full property IRI which has numeric value for each node. If property is not specified, node degree is used as a concentric weight. For a node, the degree is the number of edge connections it has. Each time a node is referenced as source or target of an edge in the graph, that counts as an edge connection

equidistant.description: Whether levels have an equal radial distance betwen them, may cause bounding box overflow

fit.description: Whether to fit the viewport to the graph

minNodeSpacing.description: Min spacing between outside of nodes (used for radius adjustment)

padding.description: The padding on fit in pixels

sweep.description: How many radians should be between the first and last node (defaults to full circle)
